prolong.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to deliberately make something such as a feeling or an activity last longer
prolong.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I was trying to think of some way to prolong the conversation.
prolong.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: The issue divided the country and prolonged the civil war.
Successful treatment is prolonging people's lives.
No one wants to prolong the violence.
This would only prolong the unhappiness she felt.
to make something last longer than the usual time
They suggested lengthening the training period for new teachers.
New security measures have lengthened the time passengers spend in airports.
